alert.note: Alert for Douglas; Sarpy; Washington (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Omaha (Eastern Nebraska and Southeastern Iowa - Omaha Valley)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 02 at 7:57AM CDT until August 02 at 12:30PM CDT by NWS Omaha
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of southwest Iowa, including the following county, Pottawattamie. Portions of east central Nebraska, including the following counties, Douglas, Sarpy and Washington. * WHEN...Until 1100 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 757 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Omaha, Council Bluffs, Bellevue, Ralston, Bennington, Boys Town, Elkhorn, Millard, La Vista, Carter Lake, Crescent, Benson, Aksarben, Midtown, Florence, South Omaha, Standing Bear Lake, Eppley Airfield, Chalco and Zorinsky Lake. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
